Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2013 04:50PM ablydec wrote: If you feel embarrassed doing it for yourself, think of it this way:  Taking assertively good care of yourself IS for your daughter.  (At least it is ALSO for her.)  I think of that when I find I am more careful with my kids' seatbelts then with my own.  But after all, what do they want, if not a safe mommy!
Posts.Title: I would love some advice please! meme31 meme31

Posts.Content: ablydec wrote: I'm scheduled for bilateral mx tomorrow morning.  What can I expect in terms of eating?  I'm trying to prepare the best I can.  Thanks. Posts.Title: How long after surgery can one eat? Eat normally? ablydec DocBabs

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2013 10:24AM ablydec wrote: Linnyhop,    Regarding your question about anyone whose hair is coming in unevenly, I would have to say, "I'm afraid, but I hope not!"  My hair has JUST started coming in, still too thin to call a "cover" at all, but in the front (perhaps where I had a headband, possibly just for no reason) it's taking MUCH longer to show itself.  Making me nervous.  What if it never comes in in the front?  (I really shouldn't complain, because - for religious reasons - I always cover my hair anyway.  This is really just for myself.  But STILL!!)  I'm looking for reassurance that it will all eventually fill in.
